column8: This design admires the Mexican artist, Dr Lakra (Jeronimo Lopez Ramirez) - born in 1972, originally a tattooist, Ramirez has become famous for his strange artworks which involve 'modifying' old images usually from the 50's. He modifies them by adding tattoo's to the people in the images (usually women) and also adding various 'scary' objects such as snakes and skulls.
column21: This design admires the Mexican artist, Dr Lakra (Jeronimo Lopez Ramirez)
T-shirt in admiration of the great cyclist and athlete Eddy Merckx

column8: The design is inspired by M. C. Escher, one of the greatest graphic artists who is famously know for his symmetrical and mathematical designs, most notably for me his pieces entitled 'Sky and Water' and 'Liberation'.  The lithograph 'Liberation' was created by Escher in 1955 and greatly inspired me to design Escher Lobsters.  I decided to use lobsters in the graphic piece because of the interesting shapes they create and how you can see their development from the triangle into their lobster form.
column21: The design is inspired by M. C. Escher, one of the greatest graphic artists who is famously know for his symmetrical and mathematical designs, most notably for me his pieces entitled 'Sky and Water' and 'Liberation'.

column8:
This t-shirt design admires all the winners of the Formula One World Championship..

It shows all drivers who have won the championship since 1950, starting with Nino Farina all the way up to Sebastian Vettel in 2013.

Within the drivers names, I have put the years that they won the championship - here they are in order of WDC's won:

7

1994, 95, 00, 01, 02, 03, 04 Michael Schumacher

 

5

1951, 54, 55, 56, 57 Juan Manuel Fangio

 

4

2010, 11, 12, 13 Sebastian Vettel

 

3

1959, 60, 66 Jack Brabham

1975, 77, 84 Niki Lauda

1981, 83, 87 Nelson Piquet

1985, 86, 89 Alain Prost

1988, 90, 91 Ayrton Senna

 

2

1952, 53 Alberto Ascari

1962, 68 Graham Hill

1963, 65 Jim Clark

1969, 71 Jackie Stewart

1972, 74 Emerson Fittipaldi

1998, 99 Mika Hakkinen

2005, 06 Fernando Alonso

 

1

1950 Nino Farina

1958 Mike Hawthorn

1961 Phil Hill

1964 John Surtees

1967 Denny Hulme

1970 Jochen Rindt

1976 James Hunt

1978 Mario Andretti

1979 Jody Scheckter

1980 Alan Jones

1982 Keke Rosberg

1992 Nigel Mansell

1996 Damon Hill

1997 Jacques Villeneuve

2007 Kimi Raikkonen

2008 Lewis Hamilton

2009 Jenson Button

 

Wear our F1 World Champions t-shirt and show your admiration for inspirational F1 winners and their teams, throughout the years.
